text:
Hi! I'm currently using the basic template for my website and am trying to align the title of the website with the rest of the body.
Reference: <https://ashishpanigrahi.me> (Title: Ashish's blog)

I'm assuming this has to do with some CSS but am unable to figure it out.

elements.text:
Hi! I'm currently using the basic template for my website and am trying to align the title of the website with the rest of the body.
Reference:

(Title: Ashish's blog)

I'm assuming this has to do with some CSS but am unable to figure it out.

text:
the best way to handle this kind of issue is to open your website (or its local version) using Firefox or Chromium with the web developper tools; then you check what rules are currently being applied:

`Ashish's blog` is in a `div` with class `blog-name`

The nav bar is actually on the exact same line

elements.text: the best way to handle this kind of issue is to open your website (or its local version) using Firefox or Chromium with the web developper tools; then you check what rules are currently being applied:
Ashish's blog
is in a
div
with class
blog-name
The nav bar is actually on the exact same line

text: the difference is the vertical padding

elements.text: the difference is the vertical padding

text: blog-name has a top-padding of 10px; the nav has no padding

elements.text: blog-name has a top-padding of 10px; the nav has no padding

text:
so in the CSS try putting

```.blog-name { padding-top: 0 }```

elements.text: so in the CSS try putting
.blog-name { padding-top: 0 }

text: Apologies if my message was not conveyed but by alignment, I meant along the x axis. The rest of the body and the title are not aligned along the same margin.

elements.text: Apologies if my message was not conveyed but by alignment, I meant along the x axis. The rest of the body and the title are not aligned along the same margin.

text: you must add the media rules too

text: I get this weird layout after adding the lines (including the media rules)

elements.text: I get this weird layout after adding the lines (including the media rules)

I'm pretty sure you didn't add what I mentioned above.

Can you remove all additions to the CSS and modify this (in your current CSS):
with this:

text:
it's going to be difficult to do this back and forth here so I'd encourage you to read maybe a few basic tutorials on CSS geometry + media screen (I'm doing this in the dark right now, it's better to do this from your code and see how things look directly)
<https://css-tricks.com/a-complete-guide-to-css-media-queries/>

attachments.title: A Complete Guide to CSS Media Queries | CSS-Tricks
attachments.text: Media queries can modify the appearance (and even behavior) or a website or app based on a matched set of conditions about the user's device, browser or system settings.
attachments.fallback: CSS-Tricks: A Complete Guide to CSS Media Queries | CSS-Tricks

text: Ok, I did make the changes as per your suggestions but still no change. I'll look into it and see if I can figure out something. Thanks for helping!
